intro: Mammillaria karwinskiana subsp. nejapensis, commonly known as the Nejapén mammillaria, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its short, cylindrical stems covered in white to grayish woolly spines. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun exposure. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
